title: Happy Camper 2014 Merlot (California)
description: The emphasis in this light-bodied wine is on fresh, fruity flavors like strawberry and red plum, which go well with the soft, non-tannic texture. A touch of sweetness on the finish keeps the fruity vibe going.

title: L'Oliveto 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A blend from two sites—one in the Sebastopol Hills and the other in the heart of the appellation—this is a high-toned expression of earthiness over fruit, brimming in cardamom and mushroom scents.

title: McWilliam's Hanwood Estate 2015 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
description: This fruit-driven, fruit-salad style of Chardonnay offers considerable value and refreshment. Pear and melon flavors finish with hints of pineapple and ginger. Drink now.

title: 2Hawk NV Red-Tail Red v.2 Red (Rogue Valley)
description: This Bordeaux blend is 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot and 5% each Cab Franc and Petit Verdot. Dry and astringent, it opens with a burst of pretty cherry fruit. As it breathes, some green-bean aromas and flavors develop. Best to drink this by the end of 2017.

title: Acrobat 2015 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: This is a new variety for the popular Acrobat brand. The fruit leans toward the sour side of apple, and the mouthfeel has not quite come together. Odds are that this wine will benefit from further bottle age; meanwhile, a good decanting is recommended.

title: Apothic 2015 Crush Red (California)
description: This rich, thick, soft wine has Concord grape jelly and smoky oak aromas, with sweet blackberry flavors and a touch of tannin in the texture.

title: Badia di Morrona 2015 I Sodi del Paretaio  (Chianti)
description: Comprised of 85% Sangiovese and a balance of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this laid-back Chianti offers red-skinned berry and baking spice aromas. The palate is simple, with easygoing tannins and ripe red cherry and clove flavors. Enjoy soon.

title: Vercingetorix VX 2014 Auzriel Melody En Blanc White (Oregon)
description: A barely ripe blend of Pinot Gris, Pinot Blanc, Riesling and Gewürztraminer, this has strong scents and flavors that combine in a rather strange way. Perfume, breath mint and tanned leather elements pile on, without really melding or enhancing one another. Whatever it is, it's not dull.

title: D'Arenberg 2013 The Feral Fox Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: This is muscular and sturdy for a Pinot Noir, with savory notes of mushrooms, beets and earth that add to that impression. While it lacks precision and elegance, it does offer a chunky mouthful of Pinot with ample length and intensity to the finish.

title: Broadside 2015 Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Light aromas of lemon peel, yellow pear and lemongrass make this an appealing option for pairing with Asian food of all kinds. The palate shows fresh lemon, lime peel and yellow grapefruit touches, along with a wet clay element.

title: Senda Verde 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of dusty lees, grapefruit and pine needles set up a snappy citric palate. This tastes of pithy lime, lemon and orange, while a quick-fading finish mixes citrus-peel notes with a hint of grapes skins and pyrazines.

title: Troon 2014 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)
description: This is a big tannic rustic wine, loaded with dark, bitter flavors. Cassis, espresso, smoke and charred earth all combine to carry through an astringent, tannic finish.

title: Uggiano 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Charred soil, espresso, used leather and game aromas carry over to the lean, firm palate, joined by dried black cherry and licorice flavors. The wine finishes abruptly, steeped in raspy tannins.

title: Tenuta San Vito 2014 Darno  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this easy-drinking red shows black-skinned fruit and cooking spice on the nose. Mellow tannins frame the simple palate, which is flavored with red plum and leather notes. Enjoy soon.

title: SeaGlass 2015 Riesling (Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: A slight effervescence marks this bottling from a Trinchero brand. It's fresh on the nose, with key lime, chalk and ripe Asian pear aromas, all hinting at sweetness. The palate is in fact lightly sweet but not cloying, offering ripe red apple, honeyed pear and jasmine flavors.

title: SeaGlass 2015 Rosé (Monterey County)
description: Red plum and raspberry show on the nose of this bottling. There's a kick of acidity to the palate and a subtle fruit-skin texture on the attack, with strawberry and light baking spice flavors.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Earthy chocolaty slightly raisiny and murky aromas are not as fresh and popping as they could be. This high-acidity Tempranillo feels full and chewy, while herbal chocolaty red-fruit flavors are fiery on the finish.

title: Lander-Jenkins 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is firm and moderately tannic. It has strong oaky spice aromas and ripe raspberry and cherry flavors, liberally accented with more oaky spices such as cinnamon, vanilla and coconut.

title: Uggiano 2015 La Casa di Dante Alighieri  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: This laid-back blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with iris and underbrush aromas. The bright, simple palate evokes red cherry and green tea, blanketed in soft tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Vercingetorix VX 2014 Reserve Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This reserve offers rather light strawberry fruit, and some highlights of tobacco and milk chocolate. It spent 18 months in one-third new French oak. Despite the reserve tag and the excellent vintage, it comes across as simple and a bit dilute.

title: 2Hawk 2014 Tempranillo (Southern Oregon)
description: From purchased (non-estate) grapes, this shows strong scents and flavors of raw wood, which tend to overtake the lighter plum and cherry fruit. Tannins are a bit rough also, astringent with a touch of black tea.

title: 60 Souls 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Fresher is better as a general rule for inexpensive Oregon Pinots, so grab this new release for near-term drinking. Light red fruits and a dash of chocolate carry the flavors, with a slight hint of bouillon to wrap it up.

title: Ancient Oak Cellars 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spritzy and spicy, this wine is ripe with black cherry and baked plum fruit and a strong streak of earthy forest floor. Moderate acidity supports the girth of the fruit.

title: Château Laubès 2010  Bordeaux
description: This is a wine that is almost mature. With generous black fruits and tannins that are integrated into the texture, the wine is ripe and fruity. The acidity is still there, giving a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Di Giorgio Family Wines 2013 Lucindale Chardonnay (Limestone Coast)
description: This medium-bodied wine balances pineapple fruit with bright acids and mid-range alcohol. It's a simple, citrusy quaff that finishes crisp and clean. Drink now.

title: Cavalierino 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: As reserved on the nose as on the palate, this Rosso shows faint dried black cherry and licorice notes. The subtlest hint of thyme marks the finish.

title: Charles Krug 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is simple in its silky smooth expression of blackberry, chocolate and sweet tobacco flavors, imparting full-bodied concentration and modest oak.

title: Château Cayla 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: The wine is firm and still structured. With wood, dense tannins and just the hint of juicy black-currant fruit, it needs time. From 2019, it should be a richer fruitier wine, always with a tannic core.

title: Château du Parc 2013  Saint-Émilion
description: Considering the relatively light nature of the vintage, this wine has been overmanipulated. Hard tannins and a bitter chocolate flavor are all too much for the fruit. A gentler approach would have been better.

title: Château Fontesteau 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: This is an ancient 13th-century fortified castle with an impressive keep. The wine is more in a modern style, full of crisp fruits and with attractive balanced tannins. There is a smoky edge from the wood aging and intense black-currant acidity. Drink from 2020.
